test_cases.name: E2E - Successful Creation of Formula Metric with Weekly Cadence and Custom Target
preconditions: A valid admin user account must exist to initiate the tests.
The test data must be correctly populated.
The source metrics ('First Metric', 'Second Metric') must already exist in the application.
The application at the specified Base URL must be available and responsive.

test_steps.action: Navigate to the Application URL.
test_steps.expected_result: The login page is displayed.

test_steps.action: Enter the user's email address and click 'Continue'.
test_steps.expected_result: The password input field is displayed.

test_steps.action: Enter the user's password and click 'Login'.
test_steps.expected_result: The user is successfully logged in and the company selection page is displayed.

test_steps.action: Select the correct company from the list.
test_steps.expected_result: The user is navigated to the application's main dashboard for the selected company.

test_steps.action: Click on 'Administration' in the top navigation menu.
test_steps.expected_result: A dropdown menu with administration options is displayed.

test_steps.action: Click on 'Manage Users' from the dropdown.
test_steps.expected_result: The 'Manage Users' page is displayed.

test_steps.action: Click the 'Invite Users' button.
test_steps.expected_result: The 'Invite Users' modal appears.

test_steps.action: Enter the email address of the user to be invited.
test_steps.expected_result: The email address is correctly entered in the input field.

test_steps.action: Set Admin privileges to 'Yes' by checking the 'Admin' checkbox.
test_steps.expected_result: The 'Admin' checkbox is checked.

test_steps.action: Click the button to send the invitation.
test_steps.expected_result: The invitation is sent and the 'Invite Users' modal closes.

test_steps.action: Scroll to the 'Pending Invitations' section.
test_steps.expected_result: The 'Pending Invitations' section is visible.

test_steps.action: Find the invited user in the 'Pending Invitations' table.
test_steps.expected_result: The invited user's email is present in the 'Pending Invitations' table.

test_steps.action: Click the tick/checkmark symbol to accept the invitation for the user.
test_steps.expected_result: The 'Accept Invite' form is displayed.

test_steps.action: Enter the first name from test data.
test_steps.expected_result: The first name is correctly entered in the 'First Name' field.

test_steps.action: Enter the last name from test data.
test_steps.expected_result: The last name is correctly entered in the 'Last Name' field.

test_steps.action: Enter the password from test data.
test_steps.expected_result: The password is correctly entered in the 'Create Password' field.

test_steps.action: Click the 'Accept Invite' button to create the user account.
test_steps.expected_result: A success message is displayed and the new user account is created.

test_steps.action: Navigate to the 'Metrics' page via the navigation menu.
test_steps.expected_result: The 'Metrics' page is displayed, showing a list of existing metrics.

test_steps.action: Click the 'Add Metric' button.
test_steps.expected_result: The metric creation form is displayed.

test_steps.action: Enter the metric name.
test_steps.expected_result: The metric name is correctly entered in the 'Name' field.

test_steps.action: Select 'Formula' from the 'Value Source' dropdown.
test_steps.expected_result: The 'Formula Builder' interface becomes visible.

test_steps.action: In the Formula Builder, search for and select the 'First Metric'.
test_steps.expected_result: The selected 'First Metric' appears in the formula display area.

test_steps.action: Click on the desired 'Operator' button.
test_steps.expected_result: The selected operator appears in the formula display area next to the first metric.

test_steps.action: Search for and select the 'Second Metric'.
test_steps.expected_result: The selected 'Second Metric' appears in the formula display area.

test_steps.action: Verify the complete formula is displayed correctly.
test_steps.expected_result: The formula display area shows '(First Metric) [Operator] (Second Metric)'.

test_steps.action: Select 'Weekly' from the 'Cadence' dropdown.
test_steps.expected_result: The cadence is set to 'Weekly'.

test_steps.action: Verify the 'Resets On' dropdown appears and select the specified day.
test_steps.expected_result: The 'Resets On' dropdown is visible and the specified day is selected.

test_steps.action: Click the green checkmark button to confirm the formula.
test_steps.expected_result: The formula is validated and accepted.

test_steps.action: Click the 'Save' button to create the metric.
test_steps.expected_result: A confirmation message appears and the new metric is listed on the Metrics page.

test_steps.action: Navigate to 'My Dashboard'.
test_steps.expected_result: The 'My Dashboard' page is displayed.

test_steps.action: Click the 'Edit KPI' icon to open the modal.
test_steps.expected_result: The 'Edit KPI' modal opens with available metrics on the left and selected KPIs on the right.

test_steps.action: Locate the newly created metric in the left panel and click it to add it to the right panel.
test_steps.expected_result: The metric moves from the left panel to the right panel.

test_steps.action: Click the 'Save' button in the modal to update the dashboard.
test_steps.expected_result: The modal closes and the dashboard refreshes to show the new metric card.

test_steps.action: Locate the correct metric card on the dashboard.
test_steps.expected_result: The newly added metric card is visible in the 'My KPIs' section.

test_steps.action: Hover over the metric card to reveal the three-dot menu button.
test_steps.expected_result: The three-dot menu button becomes visible on the metric card.

test_steps.action: Click the three-dot menu button to open the dropdown.
test_steps.expected_result: A dropdown menu with options like 'Edit' appears.

test_steps.action: Click the 'Edit' option from the dropdown menu.
test_steps.expected_result: The user is navigated to the 'Edit Metric' page.

test_steps.action: On the Edit page, select the 'Target' tab.
test_steps.expected_result: The target configuration options are displayed.

test_steps.action: Select the 'Custom' radio button.
test_steps.expected_result: The input fields for 'Level 1', 'Level 2', 'Level 3', and 'Level 4' appear.

test_steps.action: Enter the 'Level 1', 'Level 2', 'Level 3', and 'Level 4' target values.
test_steps.expected_result: All four target value fields are populated with the correct data.

test_steps.action: Click the 'Save' button to save the target configuration.
test_steps.expected_result: The target configuration is saved and the page navigates back to the dashboard.

test_steps.action: Verify the metric card on the dashboard.
test_steps.expected_result: The metric card now displays visual indicators for the configured custom target.

test_cases.name: E2E - Successful Creation of Formula Metric with Time-Based Target
preconditions: A valid user is logged in and on the 'My Dashboard' page.
The source metrics ('First Metric', 'Second Metric') must already exist in the application.
The application at the specified Base URL must be available and responsive.

test_steps.action: Navigate to the 'Metrics' page from the main navigation menu.
test_steps.expected_result: The 'Metrics' page is displayed.

test_steps.action: Click the 'Add Metric' button.
test_steps.expected_result: The metric creation form is displayed.

test_steps.action: Enter the metric name.
test_steps.expected_result: The metric name is correctly entered in the 'Name' field.

test_steps.action: Select 'Formula' from the 'Value Source' dropdown.
test_steps.expected_result: The 'Formula Builder' interface becomes visible.

test_steps.action: Use the Formula Builder to select a 'First Metric', an 'Operator', and a 'Second Metric'.
test_steps.expected_result: The complete formula is constructed and displayed correctly.

test_steps.action: Select 'Monthly' from the 'Cadence' dropdown.
test_steps.expected_result: The cadence is set to 'Monthly'.

test_steps.action: Click the green checkmark button to confirm the formula.
test_steps.expected_result: The formula is validated and accepted.

test_steps.action: Click the 'Save' button to create the metric.
test_steps.expected_result: A confirmation message appears and the new metric is created.

test_steps.action: Navigate to 'My Dashboard'.
test_steps.expected_result: The 'My Dashboard' page is displayed.

test_steps.action: Click the 'Edit KPI' icon to open the modal.
test_steps.expected_result: The 'Edit KPI' modal opens.

test_steps.action: Find and click the new metric in the left panel to add it to the dashboard.
test_steps.expected_result: The metric moves from the available metrics panel to the selected KPIs panel.

test_steps.action: Click 'Save' in the modal.
test_steps.expected_result: The modal closes and the dashboard refreshes with the new metric card.

test_steps.action: Locate the correct metric card on the dashboard.
test_steps.expected_result: The new metric card is visible on the dashboard.

test_steps.action: Hover over the card and click the three-dot menu button.
test_steps.expected_result: A dropdown menu appears.

test_steps.action: Click the 'Edit' option from the dropdown menu.
test_steps.expected_result: The user is navigated to the 'Edit Metric' page.

test_steps.action: On the Edit page, select the 'Target' tab.
test_steps.expected_result: The target configuration options are displayed.

test_steps.action: Select the 'Time-Based' radio button.
test_steps.expected_result: The 'Start' and 'Target' input fields appear.

test_steps.action: Verify the 'Start' and 'Target' input fields appear.
test_steps.expected_result: Both 'Start' and 'Target' input fields are visible and enabled.

test_steps.action: Enter the 'Start Value' from test data.
test_steps.expected_result: The 'Start Value' is correctly entered.

test_steps.action: Enter the 'Target Value' from test data.
test_steps.expected_result: The 'Target Value' is correctly entered.

test_steps.action: Click the 'Save' button to save the target configuration.
test_steps.expected_result: The target is saved and the page navigates back to the dashboard.

test_steps.action: Verify the page navigates back to the dashboard.
test_steps.expected_result: The 'My Dashboard' page is displayed.

test_steps.action: Verify the metric card on the dashboard.
test_steps.expected_result: The metric card now displays the time-based progress indicator, start value, and target value.

test_cases.name: User Management - Successful Invitation and Acceptance of a New Admin User
preconditions: A valid admin user is logged in and on the 'Administration' -> 'Manage Users' page.
The application at the specified Base URL must be available and responsive.

test_steps.action: Click the 'Invite Users' button.
test_steps.expected_result: The 'Invite Users' modal appears.

test_steps.action: Enter the 'Invite User Email' in the email input field.
test_steps.expected_result: The email address is correctly entered.

test_steps.action: Locate the 'Admin' checkbox and check it.
test_steps.expected_result: The 'Admin' checkbox is checked, granting admin privileges.

test_steps.action: Click the 'Send Invite' button.
test_steps.expected_result: The invitation modal closes and the invitation is sent.

test_steps.action: Verify the invitation modal closes.
test_steps.expected_result: The 'Invite Users' modal is no longer visible.

test_steps.action: Scroll to the 'Pending Invitations' section and find the invited user's email.
test_steps.expected_result: The invited user's email is found in the 'Pending Invitations' table.

test_steps.action: Click the tick/checkmark symbol in the Actions column for the invited user.
test_steps.expected_result: The 'Accept Invite' form is displayed.

test_steps.action: Verify the 'Accept Invite' form is displayed.
test_steps.expected_result: The form for entering user details is visible.

test_steps.action: Enter the 'User First Name'.
test_steps.expected_result: The first name is correctly entered.

test_steps.action: Enter the 'User Last Name'.
test_steps.expected_result: The last name is correctly entered.

test_steps.action: Enter the 'User Password'.
test_steps.expected_result: The password is correctly entered.

test_steps.action: Click the 'Accept Invite' button.
test_steps.expected_result: A success message is displayed and the user is navigated to the dashboard.

test_steps.action: Verify a success message is displayed and the user is navigated to the dashboard.
test_steps.expected_result: The new user account is created successfully and the dashboard is loaded.
